channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-12447] Add support for setTimeRange for RowCounter and CellCounter
item.description: It would be nice to count the rows/cells also for a time range. Copy Table already supports that.
item.summary: Add support for setTimeRange for RowCounter and CellCounter

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: Patch also adds support to use TimeRange in scan.setTimeRange().

Do we really need another method in Scan?
why CellCounter can't do the exact same thing as CopyTable is doing?

+1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment

against trunk revision .

This message is automatically generated.

Matteo Bertozzi Added the new method in Scan since it was odd not having support to pass a TimeRange as an argument. Probably tooling is the onIy one that will use but I can remove if you think it might cause some confusion.

why CellCounter can't do the exact same thing as CopyTable is doing?

Yeah, CellCounter needs to be rewritten to be consistent with other MR tools we have. I think the main problem with CellCounter is that it relies on the position for the options from the command line and for instance modifiers like separator string need to be on a fixed. I will open a new JIRA to clean up the command line option parsing for CellCounter.
Created HBASE-12458 to follow up the improvement of CellCounter option parsing.

Added the new method in Scan since it was odd not having support to pass a TimeRange as an argument.

so, why just scan and not Get too? get and scan have the same setTimeStamp() and setTimeRange() if you want to add the new method it should be in both. but unless it is really necessary I don't see the point of adding a new method, also because nothing else seems to be exposing TimeRange directly.
Matteo Bertozzi good point. Removed the new method and used a simple array just for now, CellCounter can be cleaned up in another JIRA.
+1 looks good to me
Nice tests Esteban Gutierrez I applied to master. If you want it in branch-1 and before, can you make a patch (it won't cherry-pick nicely at mo). Thanks boss.
